title: The Gorsuch Process: Unprecedented Access and Transparency – The White House
content:
Fact Sheets			

		Law & Justice	

Issued on:
March 31, 2017
Prior to the nomination of Judge Gorsuch, the White House spoke with 29 Senators to seek their advice on the nomination.Judge Gorsuch is the very definition of a mainstream judge.Since his nomination was announced on January 31, Judge Gorsuch has met with nearly 80 Senators.Judge Gorsuch has gone above and beyond to be fully transparent with and responsive to Senators regarding his record. Prior to the hearing, and in response to requests from the Senate Judiciary Committee, Judge Gorsuch provided:At the request of the Senate Judiciary Committee Chairman and Ranking Member, the Department of Justice (DOJ) and the White House Archives produced over 180,000 pages of email and paper records related to Judge Gorsuch’s time at the DOJ.Judge Gorsuch sat for three rounds of questioning by the Senate Judiciary Committee totaling nearly 20 hours.Judge Gorsuch answered nearly 1,200 questions during his hearing.Judge Gorsuch was given 299 questions for the record by Democrats on the Senate Judiciary Committee—the most in recent history of Supreme Court nominees.Democrats made up their mind on Judge Gorsuch before he was even nominated.
